body:
Robert W. Baird reaffirmed their outperform rating on shares of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) in a report published on Tuesday morning. The brokerage currently has a $133.00 target price on the iPhone maker’s stock.

Several other analysts have also weighed in on the stock. Cowen and Company reiterated an outperform rating on shares of Apple in a research note on Tuesday. Needham & Company LLC reissued a top pick rating and issued a $150.00 price target on shares of Apple in a research report on Tuesday. Barclays PLC downgraded shares of Apple from an overweight rating to an equal weight rating and reduced their price target for the company from $119.00 to $117.00 in a research report on Tuesday. Sanford C. Bernstein set a $140.00 price target on shares of Apple and gave the company a buy rating in a research report on Monday. Finally, Stifel Nicolaus reissued a reduce rating and issued a $115.00 price target on shares of Apple in a research report on Monday. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have given a hold rating, forty-one have issued a buy rating and three have assigned a strong buy rating to the stock. Apple has a consensus rating of Buy and a consensus target price of $130.09.

Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) traded up 1.595% during mid-day trading on Tuesday, reaching $121.883. 20,020,218 shares of the company’s stock traded hands. The stock has a market cap of $649.92 billion, a P/E ratio of 14.667 and a beta of 1.30. The company has a 50 day moving average price of $116.82 and a 200-day moving average price of $111.12. Apple has a 12 month low of $89.47 and a 12 month high of $121.90.

In other Apple news, insider Daniel J. Riccio sold 33,323 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, November 3rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $110.35, for a total value of $3,677,193.05. Following the sale, the insider now directly owns 32,484 shares in the company, valued at $3,584,609.40. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which can be accessed through this link. Also, CEO Timothy D. Cook sold 30,000 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Thursday, January 19th. The shares were sold at an average price of $120.00, for a total value of $3,600,000.00. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. Over the last 90 days, insiders sold 187,559 shares of company stock worth $21,715,924. 0.08% of the stock is owned by insiders.

A number of hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of AAPL. REDW Stanley Financial Advisors LLC acquired a new stake in Apple during the fourth quarter worth $1,782,000. Cascade Investment Advisors Inc. acquired a new stake in Apple during the fourth quarter worth $3,843,000. Headinvest LLC acquired a new stake in Apple during the fourth quarter worth $1,870,000. Asset Planning Services Ltd. boosted its stake in Apple by 0.3% in the fourth quarter. Asset Planning Services Ltd. now owns 7,859 shares of the iPhone maker’s stock worth $910,000 after buying an additional 24 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Massey Quick & Co. LLC acquired a new stake in Apple during the fourth quarter worth $1,667,000. Institutional investors own 58.95% of the company’s stock.

Apple Inc (Apple) designs, manufactures and markets mobile communication and media devices, personal computers, and portable digital music players, and a variety of related software, services, peripherals, networking solutions, and third-party digital content and applications. The Company’s products and services include iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod, Apple TV, a portfolio of consumer and professional software applications, the iOS and OS X operating systems, iCloud, and a variety of accessory, service and support offerings.

title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Given Outperform Rating at Robert W. Baird
